The Szeged Centre for Vocational Training School Deri Miksa continue training in technical fields, especially engineering and information technology fields, but progress has been dealing with the effect of automation and mechatronics training as well, as well as the mechanical and CNC machining is in training. The sending institution wants to send foreign internships and foreign training, three groups of students and two group of teachers for the vocational courses during the project. To Denmark, Viborg 6 students (manufacturing engineering technicians, mechatronics technicians, automation technicians) in October 2017 (2 weeks), to the local training center. To United Kingdom, Portsmouth in 2 week turns two groups, a total of 20 students (one group consisted of 8 CAD-CAM information technology, 2 manufacturing engineering technicians) to Infonetmedia Ltd. and Norjon Engineers Ltd. in November 2017 (2x2weeks). To France, Nîmes 6 teachers (technical, linguistic and vocational teachers) in February-March 2018 (2 weeks), in the French vocational school. To Denmark, Viborg 6 teachers (technical, linguistic and vocational teachers) in February-March 2018 (2 weeks), to Mercantec training center. The students will be disadvantaged as well, among them most of the “big family”, living in modest financial circumstances. The applicant institution in the conduct of international mobility can help. The main goal of this project set out that the participating VET students and teachers familiarize themselves with new used technologies in abroad and they transfer these things to domestic practice, teaching practice and thereby strengthen the labor market employment opportunities. During the project, we focus on the development of general and professional language, mobility willingness to promote the development opportunities of the new directions. With the host partners, we put together the work programs for pupils and teachers, allowing the development of professional competencies (linguistic, technical, educational methodology). In the project we used the ECVET principles, which facilitate the adoption of the gained knowledge at home and abroad. Among the primary concerns can be found students develop social skills, their teamwork, communication skills, self-development and strengthening. The positive impact of the participating in addition to the impact of the institutions is also significant, such as curriculum development, promote enrollment. The project's ultimate goal in any case is that the new knowledge, experience packed with students from the school bypassing much faster and more easily able to get a job in today's difficult economic situation. The program is a long-term cooperation start / resume along with partners for mutual benefit.

"Future Career? Touch IT! " is a project that aims to facilitate the transition from school to work of young graduates specialising in mathematics-informatics with intensive English study from "Dimitrie Cantemir"  National College Onesti, making their insertion into the labour market, whether national or international, easier.The target group is represented by 20 students rigorously selected  from 11th grade students of mathematics -informatics with intensive English classes . Divided into two flows of 10 students each, they will participate in 3-week traineeships organized in July 2017 and  July 2018, respectively, in Portsmouth, UK . Since the majority of students will be travelling abroad for the first time, they will be accompanied by a specialized teacher who, besides being in charge with the coordination of the group, will be their element of stability in an environment completely new to them.By attending the traineeship, participants will not only improve their abilities, skills and practical knowledge in the field of their professional qualification (IT), but they will also acquire new skills in Android, an operating system which is not taught in Romanian schools . They will also practice and enrich language, cultural and social skills, becoming well-trained young  people able to perform in the field, representing the future human resource in IT companies or even willing to become future entrepreneurs in the field. Their digital competence will improve since the traineeship will offer access to new and updated knowledge in a market rapidly and continously changing. In addition, trainees will adapt more easily to the current requirements of  the economy  and they will find it easier to integrate into the national and international labour market.Given that approximately 40% of our pupils come from rural areas and for most of the selected pupils this mobility will be the first direct contact with the Western world, their involvement in project activities will provide them not only the opportunity to work within companies, but also to live for 3 weeks in a multicultural environment, developing the capacity to adapt to new environments. When returning home after the traineeship they will feel enriched not only professionally but also personally, they will feel more confident, proud to have represented our country in a multicultural environment. The rigour of all the actions provided within the framework of a European project, pupils' active participation, the sense of discipline, teamwork, organizational skills and completed activities, self-confidence, confidence in others, growing interest in human relationships are just a few examples of best practices acquired by the future employees in the labour market thanks to this traineeship in Europe.

Our project arises from the intention to improve the skills of our students of Vocational Training: languages, social skills, professional skills, employability of students, promoting equity and inclusion...
We believe that it is very important training in languages of our students, and our current curriculum of vocational education does not contemplate such a possibility; thus, with our project we aim to solve a clear lack of training.
And with regard to social skills: it is clear that a mobility of 3 months in a foreign country, with some independence and a lot of responsibility, will be very useful for our candidates.
Our previous experience has been a successful program of mobility of students of higher grade. For several years we have been sending students of higher education through the Erasmus program+, with considerable success, and our intention is to extend the program to all levels of vocational training. We have been working since 2006 with programs of this type (European mobility of students to practice in company), and we have very clear benefits.
The project: mobility of our students of FP (Middle Grade) for a traineeship in a company of the United Kingdom or Italy, valuable for their diploma: Technician in Microcomputer Systems and Networks.
We will send 10 students: 5 the first year and 5 the second. One year the students will go to the United Kingdom and another to Italy. The students will have to fulfill certain conditions: to have passed all other modules of the VET studies is mandatory. The candidates can also be recent graduates who wish to complete an internship with no need to be validated for the diploma. Those who can be at risk of social exclusión will take over other candidates, as well as those who show foreign language knowledges.
Students will be required to prepare a large part of the trip on your own: plane tickets, accommodation (although you will have the option to use a residence), insurance, documentation... Learn how to develop a curriculum vitae Europass. Will have to go through several filters: qualifications (all passed), a minimum level of language, positive report of the educational team and the Guidance Department... 
The internships will last 3 months (89 work days and 2 for the trip). The follow-up will be telematic, with the possibility of an optional follow-up visit.
On the way back, students will obtain, in addition to its title of Vocational Training, some extras: a Europass Mobility certificate, a certificate issued by the company and another issued by the Institute.
We intend to meet the objectives of the Project, which are:
1. Recognition of mobility: both educational level and acquired skills.
2. Dissemination and use of project results, both within the school and outside it
3. Improvement in the quality of the procedures used
4. International dimensión
5. Multilingualism and interculturality
6. Equality and inclusion, employability and improving the situation of pupils at risk of exclusión
7. Protection and security of the participants
By last, it is necessary to prepare a report for the direction of our center and for the Department of Computer Science, and give publicity to the results obtained through the means available, such as the web page of the Center, annual Dissemination Workshops that are organized in the center, and other means at our disposal. And finally we will make an assessment of the project as a whole, face to capitalize on the experience gained.
In the long term, we hope this project to be the gateway of new international projects, and that really helps the inclusion of our students in the labor market, which is our most important objective.

Project Title: SMART Technology - key role for professional and social success of learnersParticipating organizations:1. National College "Costache Negruzzi" - Iasi, Romania2. Training Vision Ltd. - Portsmouth, United Kingdom3. Berlink - Berlin, GermanyBackground: The needs identified among learners:- The need for user training and skills development for using programs such as android, because in our school there is no option to develop this theme, but there are demands from learners and parents.- The need to correlate local entrepreneurs` social skills with the school offer .- Necessity of connection between theoretical instructive programming work performed in the virtual aspect of the concrete realization of program codes for smart devices;- The need to get acquainted with the working environment in the context of real work in IT companies, with activities in:           Infonetmedia (UK), Centre Adlershof (DE) GmbH (DE), Apple Store Berlin (DE) and LinguaTV (DE).- Facilitating the transition from school to working life: the domain of programming smart devices nowadays is closely linked with the business, and work environment of enterprises;- The need for socio-professional of values exchange, ethnic and cultural underpinning of a business relationship between the parties involved, through visits to universities, exhibitions, places, monuments, museums and theaters.The overall project aims to increase access to quality education for 28 high school students, through educational approaches aimed at developing competencies required by modern society and the educational process optimization using SMART technology.Specific objectives:1. Develop IT skills for 28 students through training in the development of software for smart devices, a specialized company for personal development and for improving employability in the labor market.2. Enchancing linguistic skills of the participants following this training course in UK / Germany, the language of communication being English and through direct interaction with the residents, to develop the skills required by modern society.3. The increase of the general knowledge of the participants through understanding the cultural of English / Germany, but also about the life and work of the countries visited.4. Developing institutional capacity to develop projects with grant funding, conclude national and international partnerships, improving management skills, to increase the prestige of the school.The target group consists of 28 learners from X grade, boys and girls, urban and rural, mathematics and computer science specialization, which will perform 60 hours of practice / laboratory in the development of software for smart devices.Their English language skills are minimal A2.Activities during the internship: development and implementation of applications using Android App programming for smart devices. In addition, they will perform:- visits to tourist objectives in Portsmouth, London and Winchester / Museumsisland and Bundestag respectively.Expected results of the training activity among learners are: -28 High school learners trained through educational approaches aimed at developing competencies required by modern society and the educational process optimization of using SMART technology;- 28 learners with knowledge and skills in programming development;- 28 learners who consolidated their language skills by participating in the training program in the UK / Germany;- 28 learners with a general knowledge greatly enhanced by knowledge, cultural understanding of English / Germany, but also about the life and work enviroment in this country;- 28 learners with increased chances of integration on the labor market.The impact will be multidimensional, on the development of organizational forms of training that are not possible without using traditional methods and means. Learning deed is no longer considered to be the effect of the actions of the teacher, but the result of the student's interactions with the leading learning.Project sustainability:The project includes operations and activities to ensure continuity, value, integrated approach of the results after finalization of the project and can be transferred locally and nationally. The project aims at a wide promotion of its results through extensive promotion activities directly through the applicant, the partners and participants.

The British Red Cross International Youth Volunteering Project's mission is to provide high quality long-term international volunteering experiences to 29 young people from across Europe, aged 18-30. We prioritise making our placements accessible to those with fewer opportunities, as defined by the ERASMUS+ Inclusion and Diversity Strategy, and those who will benefit most from the personal and social development opportunities which the scheme offers. Selected volunteers will have the opportunity to take part in a range of humanitarian projects, which will enable them to enhance their intercultural learning and develop their understanding and experience of active citizenship in a global world. The various projects included in this application are thematically linked by a common commitment to the inclusion of vulnerable groups, both at the local and community level; this focuses primarily on supporting vulnerable individuals in the community (refugees and asylum seekers; the elderly) and providing first aid learning opportunities to increase resilience: In line with wider EVS goals, our International Youth Volunteering Programme (IYV) has a number of specific objectives:- To encourage young people's active citizenship and participation in civil society;- To facilitate opportunities for young people to develop international friendship and understanding;- To provide a mechanism for young people to actively contribute to building more resilient communities in Europe through their involvement in service delivery;- To encourage social inclusion by ensuring participation among disadvantaged youth as well as projects with an inclusion focus; - To enhance the employability of young people and develop their knowledge and experience of volunteering in the social sector.Through a range of informal and non-formal learning activities and experiences, volunteers will be supported over the course of the placement to take an active role in society, and will also have the space for personal development, self-reflection and learning. The personal development and training opportunities available will enable participants to develop skills crucial for future training or employment, while given them the chance to be engaged as active citizens in civil society. At the local level, the participants will be directly involved with the delivery of services to vulnerable people in the community. Their contact with community groups who may otherwise have little contact with people from overseas enables the intercultural learning from the programme to spread more broadly than the participants themselves. The volunteers will also be encouraged to proactively engage the communities in which they volunteer with issues around European identity. Engaging Red Cross National Societies across Europe, the project enables collaboration at the EU level and encourages cross cultural learning and understanding.
